Package com.gemalto.idp.mobile.core

Class SecurityDetectionService

java.lang.Object
com.gemalto.idp.mobile.core.SecurityDetectionService
public final class SecurityDetectionService extends Object
Security Detection services are provided in this class where application can implement interfaces to receive warning when security violations are detected.
Since:
4.4

  • Constructor Details

    • SecurityDetectionService

      public SecurityDetectionService()

  • Method Details

    • setHookingDetectionListener

      public static void setHookingDetectionListener(HookingDetectionListener listener)
      Set HookingDetectionListener to receive callbacks when protected methods in SDK are detected as hooked. If the listener is not set, SDK will not protect any methods. It is required to call this before IdpCore.configure(...). By using this option, it potentially opens one attack point, this class must be properly obfuscated.
      Parameters:
      listener - the listener to receive hooking detection callbacks.
      Since:
      4.4

    • setMalwareDetectionListener

      public static void setMalwareDetectionListener(MalwareDetectionListener listener)
      Set MalwareDetectionListener to receive callbacks when protected methods in SDK have been flagged to contain malware. If the listener is not set, SDK will not protect any methods. It is required to call this before IdpCore.configure(...). By using this option, it potentially opens one attack point, this class must be properly obfuscated.
      Parameters:
      listener - the listener to receive malware detection callbacks.
      Since:
      6.6.0

    • setDeviceIntegrityDetectionListener

      public static void setDeviceIntegrityDetectionListener(DeviceIntegrityDetectionListener listener)
      Set DeviceIntegrityDetectionListener to receive callbacks when protected methods in SDK are detected to be compromised. If the listener is not set, SDK by default will crash if device integrity check fails

      Internal SDK methods may invoke integrity checks during execution to verify the runtime environment. If any of these checks fail, the registered listener will be notified through DeviceIntegrityDetectionListener.onDeviceIntegrityFailed().

      It is required to call this before IdpCore.configure(...). By using this option, it potentially opens one attack point, this class must be properly obfuscated.
      Parameters:
      listener - the listener to receive device integrity failure callback.
      Since:
      6.7.0

    • clearDeviceIntegrityDetectionListener

      public static void clearDeviceIntegrityDetectionListener()
      Remove DeviceIntegrityDetectionListener.

      It is recommended to call this API when the implementation is no longer in use. eg. public class Activity implements DeviceIntegrityDetectionListener { When activity is killed you must remove the listener to avoid leaks. And to add back the listener when the activity is created. By using this option, it potentially opens one attack point, this class must be properly obfuscated.

      Since:
      6.7.0

    • clearHookingDetectionListener

      public static void clearHookingDetectionListener()
      Remove HookingDetectionListener.

      It is recommended to call this API when the implementation is no longer in use. eg. public class Activity implements HookingDetectionListener { When activity is killed you must remove the listener to avoid leaks. And to add back the listener when the activity is created. By using this option, it potentially opens one attack point, this class must be properly obfuscated.

      Since:
      4.4

    • clearMalwareDetectionListener

      public static void clearMalwareDetectionListener()
      Remove MalwareDetectionListener.

      It is recommended to call this API when the implementation is no longer in use. eg. public class Activity implements MalwareDetectionListener { When activity is killed you must remove the listener to avoid leaks. And to add back the listener when the activity is created. By using this option, it potentially opens one attack point, this class must be properly obfuscated.

      Since:
      6.6.0

    • setDebuggerDetection

      public static void setDebuggerDetection(Boolean enableDebuggerDetection)
      Set debugger detection to prevent any debugger attach to the application process. This function will be ignore if the application is deployed on debug mode. It is required to call this before IdpCore.configure(...). This option applies only for native debugger detection. Java debugger detection is always set ON in the release binary. This API only configures native debugger detection, no impact on Java debugger detection By using this option, it potentially opens one attack point, this class must be properly obfuscated.
      Parameters:
      enableDebuggerDetection - the value to set, true or false. If not set, the default value is false prior to 4.8. Since 4.8, it has been turned ON by default.
      Since:
      4.6

    • getPotentialOverlayAttackAppInfo

      public static Set<String> getPotentialOverlayAttackAppInfo()
      Detects if there are apps installed(non-system app) which will potentially do overlay attack, and return the app info. The complete list of application package names are returned each time the function is invoked. Integrators can maintain a whitelist of applications where it does not need to warn the end-user again for the applications already been trusted.
      Returns:
      Set of ApplicationID(application package name) of the apps which have been detected have potential to do overlay attack, if found.
      Since:
      4.9.0

    • detectMalware

      public static void detectMalware()
      This method checks for the list of packages which have been flagged to contain malware. This method provides package name regarding any potentially malicious or suspicious applications installed on the device.

      The information is returned via the provided MalwareDetectionListener, which can be used to handle the detection results. Integrator can use the package-name to identify non-system apps that might pose security risks

      The complete list of detected applications package-name is returned each time this method is called. Before calling this method, the listener must be set using setMalwareDetectionListener(MalwareDetectionListener). If the listener is not set, a default malware detection mechanism will be enabled by the SDK. However, without the listener, the SDK may cause the application to crash if malware is detected. Therefore, it is recommended to set the listener to handle detection results properly.
      Since:
      6.6.0

    • setVirtualEnvironmentDetectionListener

      @Deprecated public static void setVirtualEnvironmentDetectionListener(VirtualEnvironmentDetectionListener listener)
      Deprecated.
      This api is deprecated since 6.2 as enhanced hooking detection is introduced.
      Registering a listener to handle the result from Virtual Environment detection. By default, the status will be ignored, it means the SDK will continue working as normal. !!! Important !!! This API must be called before calling to IdpCore.configure(IdpConfiguration...) otherwise, the default behaviour will be applied. By using this option, it potentially opens an attack point, hence this class must be properly obfuscated.
      Parameters:
      listener - The listener
      Since:
      5.4

    • clearVirtualEnvironmentDetectionListener

      @Deprecated public static void clearVirtualEnvironmentDetectionListener()
      Deprecated.
      This api is deprecated since 6.2 as enhanced hooking detection is introduced.
      Unregistering the Virtual Environment detection listener
      Since:
      5.4

    • getHookingStatus

      public static SecurityDetectionService.DetectorResult getHookingStatus(SecureList<Object> target) throws IdpSecurityDetectorException
      Checks if all the functions in the registered class(es) are safe.
      Parameters:
      target - List of the Class objects that contain the functions need to be protected.
      Returns:
      SecurityDetectionService.DetectorResult.NEGATIVE if the functions are safe, otherwise SecurityDetectionService.DetectorResult.POSITIVE is returned.
      Throws:
      IdpSecurityDetectorException - An exception occurs while processing the input data. For example, not getting the information of the protected function.

      Possible error:
      • IdpResultCode.SECURITY_DETECTOR_HOOKING_PARSER_FAILED
      • IdpResultCode.SECURITY_DETECTOR_HOOKING_INTERNAL_ERROR
      Since:
      5.4

    • getHookingFrameworkStatus

      public static SecurityDetectionService.DetectorResult getHookingFrameworkStatus() throws IdpSecurityDetectorException
      Checks if there is any hooking framework installed on the device.
      Returns:
      SecurityDetectionService.DetectorResult.NEGATIVE if the system is clean, otherwise SecurityDetectionService.DetectorResult.POSITIVE is returned.
      Throws:
      IdpSecurityDetectorException - Exception happens while processing.

      Possible error:
      • IdpResultCode.SECURITY_DETECTOR_HOOKING_FRAMEWORK_DETECTION_FAILED
      Since:
      5.4

    • getDebuggerStatus

      public static SecurityDetectionService.DetectorResult getDebuggerStatus() throws IdpSecurityDetectorException
      Checks if the debugger is attached to the application process.

      The SDK has the debugger detection feature which is enabled by default. If a debugger is detected, the SDK will crash the application.
      Returns:
      SecurityDetectionService.DetectorResult.NEGATIVE if debugger is not detected, otherwise SecurityDetectionService.DetectorResult.POSITIVE is returned.
      Throws:
      IdpSecurityDetectorException - An exception occurs while processing the detection.

      Possible error:
      • IdpResultCode.SECURITY_DETECTOR_DEBUGGER_DETECTION_FAILED
      Since:
      5.4
      See Also:
      • setDebuggerDetection(Boolean)

    • getEmulatorStatus

      public static SecurityDetectionService.DetectorResult getEmulatorStatus() throws IdpSecurityDetectorException
      Checks if the application is running on an emulator.
      Returns:
      SecurityDetectionService.DetectorResult.NEGATIVE if the emulator is not detected, otherwise SecurityDetectionService.DetectorResult.POSITIVE if the emulator is detected.
      Throws:
      IdpSecurityDetectorException - If any error occurs
      Since:
      5.4

    • getVirtualMachineEnvironmentDetectionStatus

      public static SecurityDetectionService.DetectorResult getVirtualMachineEnvironmentDetectionStatus()
      Checks if the application is running on a virtual machine environment.
      Returns:
      SecurityDetectionService.DetectorResult.NEGATIVE if a virtual machine environment is not detected, otherwise SecurityDetectionService.DetectorResult.POSITIVE if a virtual machine environment is detected.
      Since:
      6.6.0

    • getDeviceIntegrityStatus

      public static SecurityDetectionService.DetectorResult getDeviceIntegrityStatus() throws IdpSecurityDetectorException
      Performs a device integrity check
      Returns:
      SecurityDetectionService.DetectorResult.NEGATIVE if the device integrity check pass, otherwise SecurityDetectionService.DetectorResult.POSITIVE is returned.
      Throws:
      IdpSecurityDetectorException - Exception happens while processing.

      Possible error:
      • IdpResultCode.SECURITY_DETECTOR_DEVICE_INTEGRITY_FAILED
      • IdpResultCode.SECURITY_DETECTOR_DEVICE_INTEGRITY_INTERNAL_ERROR
      Since:
      6.7.0
